alert.note: Alert for Clay; Early (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 15 at 10:28AM EDT until June 15 at 10:45AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM EDT FOR SOUTHERN CLAY AND NORTHWESTERN EARLY COUNTIES... At 1028 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles south of Fort Gaines, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Fort Gaines, Blakely, Bellville, Bluffton, Colomokee, Harrisons Mill, Ferrell Crossroads, Zetto, Early Co A/p, Kolomoki Mounds Sp and Suttons Corner. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM EDT for southeastern Alabama...and southwestern Georgia. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
